lead_paragraph: A lawyer for the California Insurance Commission said today that he was optimistic that a $643 million Federal tax claim against the failed Executive Life Insurance Company would be settled with a $10 million payment. Karl Rubinstein, a lawyer for the state's Insurance Commissioner, John Garamendi, said the claim might be settled with a $77 million payment to the Internal Revenue Service. About $67 million of that amount was already paid when regulators seized the institution in April after it collapsed under its heavy investment in junk bonds.
